column4: European Parliament proposing Internet search-service unbundling
column5: SAN FRANCISCO The European Parliament is preparing to call for the separation of search engines from other commercial services to ensure a level playing field for the Internet industry  according to a draft motion seen by Reuters on Friday  presenting a threat to leading search engine Google Inc.

column4: Alibaba prints jumbo deal without China premium
column5: SINGAPORE (IFR) - Alibaba Group Holding  sold the largest bond by an Asian company last night via a $8 billion six-tranche offering. The tight pricing achieved on the deal led many to believe the US-listed Chinese ecommerce giant got away without paying a Chinese premium.

column4: Brazil's Rousseff struggling to limit Petrobras scandal's damage
column5: SAO PAULO/BRASILIA  Nov 21 President Dilma Rousseff expects a bribery scandal at state-run oil company Petrobras to deteriorate in coming months  aides say  with arrests possible for some political allies and potentially serious damage to an economy that is already struggling.

column4: New Issue-Praxair prices 500 mln euro 2025 bond
column5: Underlying govt bond    over midswaps  equivalent to 93.8bp

column4: RBC to trim wealth management  international advisory unit
column5: TORONTO Royal Bank of Canada  said on Friday it is shutting down its international client-wealth-management business in the Caribbean  along with some international advisory businesses in Canada and the United States.

column5: TORONTO Royal Bank of Canada said on Friday it is shutting down its international client-wealth-management business in the Caribbean  along with some international advisory businesses in Canada and the United States.

column4: RBS admits to data error in European stress test
column5: LONDON Royal Bank of Scotland admitted on Friday it submitted erroneous data for European bank stress tests in October and had in fact only just scraped through  calling into question whether it can pass a tougher British test.

column4: UPDATE 2-RBS admits to data error in European stress test
column5: * RBS is examining how mistake was made   (Adds RBS comment)

column4: RPT-RBS says it barely passed EU stress test  admits error
column5: LONDON  Nov 21 Royal Bank of Scotland  said on Friday that it wrongly calculated its core capital for a test of its financial health by European regulators and only marginally passed a test it initially appeared to have passed comfortably.

column4: BRIEF-Zealand Pharma informs that Sanofi has confirmed development plans for LixiLan
column5: * Zealand informs that Sanofi has confirmed development plans for LixiLan at Investor Relations Thematic Seminar

column4: HK collector pays $33 million for Sotheby's blue diamond  sets record
column5: SHANGHAI A Hong Kong buyer has paid $32.6 million for a near 10-Carat blue diamond at an auction held by Sotheby's in New York  underlining the rising demand for the sparkling gems from increasingly muscular Chinese buyers.

column4: HK collector pays $33 million for Sotheby's blue diamond  sets record
column5: SHANGHAI  Nov 21 A Hong Kong buyer has paid $32.6 million for a near 10-Carat blue diamond at an auction held by Sotheby's in New York  underlining the rising demand for the sparkling gems from increasingly muscular Chinese buyers.

column4: UPDATE 1-Statoil takes $350 mln hit on Angola exploration halt
column5: OSLO  Nov 21 Norway's Statoil said on Friday it was halting exploration in Angola after poor drilling results  retreating from an offshore area it had high hopes for and capping a poor year for exploration.

column4: Sysco close to asset sale to win antitrust nod for US Foods deal: NY Post
column5: Sysco Corp   the biggest U.S. food distributor  is in advanced talks to sell some assets to a food company owned by Blackstone Group  in order to win regulatory approval for its acquisition of US Foods Inc [USFOO.UL]  the New York Post reported  citing sources.

column4: Sysco close to asset sale to win antitrust nod for US Foods deal-NY Post
column5: Nov 21 Sysco Corp  the biggest U.S. food distributor  is in advanced talks to sell some assets to a food company owned by Blackstone Group in order to win regulatory approval for its acquisition of US Foods Inc   the New York Post reported  citing sources.

column4: MOVES-Top sports banker Cornwell to join Taubman's new firm -source
column5: Nov 21 Don Cornwell  a banker who advised the Buffalo Bills NFL team on their sale earlier this year  is leaving Morgan Stanley to join the new advisory firm headed by investment banker Paul Taubman  according to a person familiar with the matter.

column4: Telecom Italia seals $1 billion masts deal  to examine tie up with Oi
column5: MILAN/BARCELONA Telecom Italia  will examine a possible tie-up between its Brazilian unit Tim Participacoes  and local group Oi   it said as it announced the sale of mobile phone masts for more than 900 million euros ($1.1 billion).

column4: UPDATE 3-Telecom Italia seals $1 bln masts deal  to examine tie up with Oi
column5: * Telecom Italia to sell Brazilian towers for over 900 mln euros

column4: Telecom Italia likely to sell Brazil towers to American Tower
column5: BARCELONA/MILAN Telecom Italia  will likely sell the mobile phone towers of its Brazilian unit to American Tower Corp  for almost the full targeted amount of 900 million euros ($1.1 billion)  two sources familiar with the situation told Reuters.

column4: Telecom Italia likely to sell Brazil towers to American Tower-sources
column5: BARCELONA/MILAN  Nov 21 Telecom Italia  will likely sell the mobile phone towers of its Brazilian unit to American Tower Corp for almost the full targeted amount of 900 million euros ($1.1 billion)  two sources familiar with the situation told Reuters.

column4: UPDATE 1-Schwab reorganizes top of retail brokerage unit
column5: Nov 21 Charles Schwab Corp has reorganized its investor services retail brokerage unit  replacing its co-heads John Clendening and Andy Gill.

column4: CNN  Cartoon Network restored to Dish subscribers
column5: Dish Network Corp and Time Warner Inc's Turner Broadcasting "mutually decided" to restore CNN  the Cartoon Network and other channels to Dish's satellite TV service  the companies said in a statement on Friday.

column4: Toyota Lexus to recall some 2006-2011 models due to fuel leak
column5: DETROIT Toyota Motor Corp  will recall 422 509 of its luxury brand Lexus vehicles in the United States because of a possible fuel leak that increases the risk of fire  U.S. regulators said on Friday.

column4: CORRECTED-Valeant slashes stake in Allergan after losing bid
column5: Nov 20 Valeant Pharmaceuticals International Inc  said it cut its stake in Allergan Inc to 0.1 percent  three days after Actavis Plc trumped its offer for the Botox maker.

column4: Valeant Pharma says may buy back up to $2 billion worth of securities
column5: Canada's Valeant Pharmaceuticals International Inc said it may buy back up to $2 billion worth of securities  replacing a previous $1.5 billion program under which it bought back no securities.

column4: Walmart workers announce Black Friday protest locations
column5: A pressure group pushing for higher wages at Walmart stores said employees would stage protests at 1 600 U.S. stores on Black Friday  including 60 in Washington.

column4: CORRECTED-UPDATE 1-Walmart workers announce Black Friday protest locations
column5: (Corrects paragraph 1 to say 60 protests will be held in Washington state  not Washington  D.C.)

column4: Walmart workers list locations for planned Black Friday protests
column5: Nov 21 A group of Walmart employees pushing for higher wages said they were planning to protest on Black Friday at 1 600 U.S. stores in areas including Washington and Los Angeles.
